X.ST: The n-queens problem is about finding how many different ways queens can be placed on a chessboard so that none attack each other. A mathematician has now all but solved it.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: There are approximately 0.143n^n configurations of peaceful queens on a n \times n chessboard.
